name: Chicken? Please Don't Be... Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: A very young chicken, also known as a squab broiler, this expensive bird is usually purchased via mail orders or from butchers. What is the French term for this delicacy?
A capon can be described as which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Castrated male chicken.

	A capon is a castrated young male chicken. Capons are very large, usually up around 8 to 10 pounds. They are often fed milk and bread for several days before processing.

questions.text: Which of the following is not usually included as a 'giblet'?
questions.explanation:
brain.

	The gizzards are eminently edible, many in the American 'heartland' love them fried.

questions.text: Boneless, skinless breasts, shallots or scallions, chicken stock, lemon juice, capers and butter...are collectively the essential ingredients of which chicken recipe?
questions.explanation:
piccata.

	The capers and the lemon juice give it the tang that makes piccata special.

questions.text: Chicken Cordon Bleu simply would not be the same without its key ingredients. Which of the following below is NOT one of these essential items?
questions.explanation:
Cottage or ricotta cheese.

	It's not hard to develop a delicious dish with the above ingredients, and copious amounts of butter!

questions.text: One well-known chicken dish involves chicken rolled around herbed butter. This dish is named for which Eastern European city?
questions.explanation:
Kiev.

	Chicken Kiev...truly delicious, and truly devastating for those desiring to lose weight!

questions.text: The following, breaded chicken cutlets covered with parmesan and mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce, describes which lovely chicken recipe?
One French country fricasse, prepared with chicken parts, bacon, and red wine, among other ingredients, is better known to us as which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Coq au vin.

	Coq means 'cock' aka 'rooster'. Vin means 'wine'....chicken with wine!

questions.text: Most expert cooks suggest that you dip your chicken in which of the following prior to preparing classic fried chicken?
questions.explanation:
buttermilk.

	Buttermilk makes the chicken very tender.

questions.text: This wonderful dish contains chicken, onions, tomatoes, olives, mushrooms, etc. goes traditionally with polenta. What is the name for this tantalizing concoction?
questions.explanation:
Cacciatore.

	Cacciatore means 'hunter's style' in Italian and is also prepared with rabbit meat.
